Please contact us with any updates. Democratic Party June 25, 2024 Education Boricua College, 2018 Campaign website Personal Facebook Hector Feliciano ( Democratic Party ) ran for election to the New York State Assembly to represent District 84 . He lost in the Democratic primary on June 25, 2024 . Feliciano completed Ballotpedia's Candidate Connection survey in 2024. Click here to read the survey answers . He attended Manhattan Community College and earned a graduate degree from Boricua College in 2018. His career experience includes working as an educator and administrator. Incumbent Amanda Septimo advanced from the Working Families Party primary for New York State Assembly District 84. Campaign themes Campaign themes 2024 2024 Ballotpedia survey responses See also: Ballotpedia's Candidate Connection Hector Feliciano completed Ballotpedia's Candidate Connection survey in 2024. The survey questions appear in bold and are followed by Feliciano's responses. Candidates are asked three required questions for this survey, but they may answer additional optional questions as well. Expand all | Collapse all Expand all Collapse all Who are you? Tell us about yourself. 84th Assembly District resident for the past 30 years Boricua College Master program graduate in Human Services. I belive in education and providing resources to the community to lead to overcome poverty, mental health, and substances abuse issues. Providing a quality of live for all our residents. Please list below 3 key messages of your campaign. What are the main points you want voters to remember about your goals for your time in office? Elect your neighbor not a stranger to represent you in Albany Come out and vote Together we can make a difference Elect your neighbor not a stranger to represent you in Albany Come out and vote Together we can make a difference What areas of public policy are you personally passionate about? Public health issues Who do you look up to? Whose example would you like to follow, and why? My mother What characteristics or principles are most important for an elected official? Persistence What qualities do you possess that you believe would make you a successful officeholder? Persistence honest What do you believe are the core responsibilities for someone elected to this office? Commitment with the constituents What legacy would you like to leave? Education for everyone What is the first historical event that happened in your lifetime that you remember? How old were you at the time? The lost of my parents in a 30 day time I was 54 years pld What was your very first job? How long did you have it? Dish washer I worked for 2 years What was the last song that got stuck in your head? John Lennon the words of all the people living in peace What is something that has been a struggle in your life? Poverty What do you believe is the ideal relationship between the governor and state legislature? Understanding the issues that effect the people What do you perceive to be your state's greatest challenges over the next decade? The isilum of new people and Crime Do you believe that it’s beneficial for state legislators to have previous experience in government or politics? No Do you believe it’s beneficial to build relationships with other legislators? Please explain your answer. Yes Is there a particular legislator, past or present, whom you want to model yourself after? No Are you interested in running for a different political office (for example, the U.S.

Congress or governor) in the future? Yes Both sitting legislators and candidates for office hear many personal stories from the residents of their district. Is there a story that you’ve heard that you found particularly touching, memorable, or impactful? One of the resident's of the District told me that she was attacted by another resident that had mental health issues I identified with her on a similar story when I was thrown with a cup of hot oatmeal while I was on my way to work. Should the legislature oversee or grant the use of emergency powers? Yes What is the first bill you would introduce if elected? Mandatory mental health treatment What committees interest you? Education Finanace and Environmen What are your views on financial transparency and government accountability? Commitment and honesty is key to lead a community Note: Ballotpedia reserves the right to edit Candidate Connection survey responses. Any edits made by Ballotpedia will be clearly marked with [brackets] for the public. If the candidate disagrees with an edit, he or she may request the full removal of the survey response from Ballotpedia.org. Ballotpedia does not edit or correct typographical errors unless the candidate's campaign requests it. 2022 2022 Hector Feliciano did not complete Ballotpedia's 2022 Candidate Connection survey. Campaign finance summary Campaign finance summary Note: The finance data shown here comes from the disclosures required of candidates and parties. Depending on the election or state, this may represent only a portion of all the funds spent on their behalf. Satellite spending groups may or may not have expended funds related to the candidate or politician on whose page you are reading this disclaimer. Campaign finance data from elections may be incomplete. For elections to federal offices, complete data can be found at the FEC website .
